text: Crăiniceanu as War Minister in 1910 Grigore C. Crăiniceanu (9 July 1852, Bucharest - 1 October 1935) was a Romanian military officer. He participated in the Romanian War of Independence.Nicolae Iorga, Voința obștii românești, p. 184. Bucharest: Editura Militară, 1983 From 1904 to 1907, he was inspector general of military engineers. From 1907 to 1909, Crăiniceanu was Chief of the Romanian General Staff. In 1909, he was promoted to divisional general. From November 1909 to December 1910, he served as War Minister in the cabinet of Ion I. C. Brătianu.Alexandru Averescu, Notițe zilnice din rǎzboi: 1916-1918, p. 113. Bucharest: Editura Militarǎ, 1992, In 1911, he was elected a titular member of the Romanian Academy. Membrii Academiei Române din 1866 până în prezent at the Romanian Academy site From 1911 to 1913, he commanded the second army corps. Sent into reserve into 1913, he was recalled to active duty upon Romania's entry into World War I, commanding the second army from August 25 to September 25, 1916. Then, from 1916 to 1917, Crăiniceanu was inspector general of the army. He founded two magazines, Revista Armatei and Cercul publicațiilor militare. ==Notes== Category:1852 births Category:1935 deaths Category:Military personnel from Bucharest Category:People of the Principality of Wallachia Category:Romanian Ministers of Defence Category:Chiefs of the General Staff of Romania Category:Romanian Land Forces generals Category:Titular members of the Romanian Academy Category:Romanian magazine founders Category:Romanian military personnel of the Russo-Turkish War (1877–1878) Category:Romanian Army World War I generals ro:Grigore Crăiniceanu
title: Grigore C. Crăiniceanu
